intro: Clypeola jonthlaspi var. petraea, commonly known as the rock clypeola, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are finely divided and adapted to reduce water loss in harsh conditions. It is often found growing on limestone or sandstone substrates in mountainous regions.
